com.tokelon.toktales.core.render.opengl.gl20

Class GLTextureDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tokelon.toktales.core.render.opengl.gl20.GLTextureDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITextureDriver

    public class GLTextureDriver
extends Object
implements ITextureDriver
    Default texture driver, cross-platform using OpenGL CompatWrapper.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GLTextureDriver(IGLErrorUtils glErrorUtils, IGL11 gl11, IGL13 gl13)

      void bindTexture(int textureLocation, int textureIndex)
      Binds the texture at the given location to the texture unit for the given index.
      int getMaxCombinedTextureUnits()
      Returns the number of texture units that are available on the GPU.
      int getMaxTextureSize()
      Returns the maximum texture size supported, in pixels.
      int getMaxTextureUnits()
      Returns the number of texture units that can be used for each state (vertex shader, fragment shader, etc.).
      int getTextureBoundToIndex(int textureIndex)
      Returns the location of the texture currently bound to the texture unit for the given index.
      int loadTexture(ITexture texture, int textureIndex)
      Loads the given texture via the GL onto the GPU.
      void unbindTexture(int textureIndex)
      Unbinds the texture on the texture unit for the given index.
      void unloadTexture(int textureLocation)
      Unloads the texture at the given location via the GL from the GPU.

      • loadTexture

        public int loadTexture(ITexture texture,
                       int textureIndex)
        Description copied from interface: ITextureDriver
        Loads the given texture via the GL onto the GPU.
        Specified by:
        loadTexture in interface ITextureDriver
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture that should be loaded.
        textureIndex - The index of the texture unit that should be used for loading. Must be in range [0, ITextureDriver.getMaxTextureUnits()).
        Returns:
        The location (name) the texture was loaded to.

      • unloadTexture

        public void unloadTexture(int textureLocation)
        Description copied from interface: ITextureDriver
        Unloads the texture at the given location via the GL from the GPU.
        Specified by:
        unloadTexture in interface ITextureDriver
        Parameters:
        textureLocation - The location (name) of the texture that should be unloaded.

      • bindTexture

        public void bindTexture(int textureLocation,
                        int textureIndex)
        Description copied from interface: ITextureDriver
        Binds the texture at the given location to the texture unit for the given index.
        Specified by:
        bindTexture in interface ITextureDriver
        Parameters:
        textureLocation - The location of the texture that should be bound.
        textureIndex - The index of the texture unit the texture should be bound to. Must be in range [0, ITextureDriver.getMaxTextureUnits()).

      • getTextureBoundToIndex

        public int getTextureBoundToIndex(int textureIndex)
        Description copied from interface: ITextureDriver
        Returns the location of the texture currently bound to the texture unit for the given index.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        textureIndex - The index of the texture unit that should be used.
        Returns:

      • getMaxTextureSize

        public int getMaxTextureSize()
        Description copied from interface: ITextureDriver
        Returns the maximum texture size supported, in pixels.

        As an example, a value of 2048 would mean support for 2D textures up to 2048x2048 size.

        Note: This value is GPU dependent.

        Specified by:
        getMaxTextureSize in interface ITextureDriver
        Returns:
        The max texture size.

      • getMaxTextureUnits

        public int getMaxTextureUnits()
        Description copied from interface: ITextureDriver
        Returns the number of texture units that can be used for each state (vertex shader, fragment shader, etc.).

        Most of the time this should be at least 8.

        Note: This value is GPU dependent.

        Specified by:
        getMaxTextureUnits in interface ITextureDriver
        Returns:
        The max texture units.

      • getMaxCombinedTextureUnits

        public int getMaxCombinedTextureUnits()
        Description copied from interface: ITextureDriver
        Returns the number of texture units that are available on the GPU.

        Note: This value is GPU dependent.

        Specified by:
        getMaxCombinedTextureUnits in interface ITextureDriver
        Returns:
        The max combined texture units.
